recipes.title: Black Eyed Pea Salsa
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Black Eyed Pea Salsa.
instructions: Mix all the ingredients together and chill for an hour or so for best
results. Serve with tortilla chips
recipes.notes: Great summer dip with fresh ingredients

recipes.title: Chex Muddy Buddies
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Chex Muddy Buddies.
ingredients: 9 c Corn Chex, Rice Chex,Wheat Chex or Chocolate Chex cereal
instructions: Measure cereal and put in large mixing bowlÍ¾ set aside.
In a microwavable bowl mix chocolate chips, peanut butter and
butter. Cook in micro on high for 1 minute.

recipes.title: Crab Cakes
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Crab Cakes.
ingredients: 4 ears of corn cleaned and whole kernal cut off
1 leek sliced thinly use as much or as little of this as you like
3/4 cup cream or half and half
instructions: In same skillet melt 1 TBS butter and add corn and leeks. Toss
until tender and add cream. Cook about 1 minute and it will
reduce.

recipes.title: Crab Dip
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Crab Dip.
instructions: Mix all ingredients together and put in a casserole dish. Bake at
350° for approximately 30 minutes, until bubbly around edges. Eat
with chips!
recipes.notes: Really great dip for parties and tailgating!

recipes.title: Ginger Tea
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Ginger Tea.
instructions: Combine all ingredients except ginger ale. Stir well to make sure
sugar is dissolved. Before serving add enough ginger ale to make 1
gallon.

recipes.title: Ham and Cheese Sliders
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Ham and Cheese Sliders.
instructions: In a small bowl, mix together mayonnaise and miracle whip.
Spread onto both sides of the center of each roll. Place a slice of
ham and a slice of Swiss inside of each roll. Close rolls and place
them into a large baking dish or heavy cookie sheet. Place very
close together.
In a medium bowl, whisk together all of the poppy seed sauce
ingredients. Pour evenly over all of the sandwiches. You do not
have to use all of the sauce! Just use enough to cover the tops. Let
sit 10 minutes or until butter sets slightly. Cover with foil and bake
at 350 degrees for 12 15 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Uncover and cook for 2 additional minutes or until tops are slightly
brown and crispy. Serve warm.
recipes.notes:
These can be assembled a day ahead and kept in
the fridge ready to bake.

recipes.title: Party Punch
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Party Punch.
instructions: Mix everything add ginger ale before serving. You can freeze half
of this in a mold to use in a punch bowl or just serve from a
pitcher.

recipes.title: Sausage Balls
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Sausage Balls.
ingredients: 2 lbs. sausage (hot or mild, your choice)
instructions: Mix all 3 ingredients together... you'll probably have to use your
hands! Roll into small balls, about the size of a golf ball.
Spray your baking sheet, bake for 20 minutes at 350°.
recipes.notes:
These are yummy as appetizers or for a breakfast/brunch
item. Dannah doesn't like sausage but she loves these!!

recipes.title: Vegetable Pizza
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Vegetable Pizza.
ingredients: 1 package Hidden Valley dressing mix (not dip mix)
instructions: Spread crescent rolls and bake until golden brown. Mix cream
cheese, mayo and dressing mix. Spread over cooled crust. Sprinkle
veggies over mixture and spinkle cheese over veggies. Cut into 2"
squares.
recipes.notes: Great appetizer or for tailgating. Travels well and is good cold!

recipes.title: Banana Bread
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Banana Bread.
ingredients: 1 cup of sugar (Splenda can be substituted)
instructions: Cream butter and sugar.
Add eggs and beat well.
Add mashed banana, baking soda, vanilla, and nuts.
Grease and flour 1 large or 2 small loaf pans.
Pour dough into pan.
Bake 300 degrees for 1 hour.
recipes.notes:
Madonna: Don't overcook! Eat heated with cream cheese...YUM YUM!
Micah: I add an extra banana

recipes.title: Colonnade Corn Muffins
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Colonnade Corn Muffins.
instructions: Preheat oven to 450°
Grease 12 muffin cups
In a large bowl, combine cornmeal, flour, baking powder and salt.
Add water, oil, buttermilk and eggs.
Beat well for 45 seconds.
Pour into greased muffin pan and bake for 15 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Cream Cheese Banana Nut Bread
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Cream Cheese Banana Nut Bread.
instructions: Beat butter and cream cheese until creamy.
Gradually add sugar, beating until light and fluffy.
Add eggs 1 at a time.
In a small bowl sift dry ingredients.
Add slowly to above mixture.
Stir in bananas and vanilla.
Bake in greased and floured loaf pans
Makes 2 loaves
TOPPING:
Prepare batter as directed and put in pans.
Stir together 1/2 cup firmly packed brown sugar, 1/2 cup chopped
nuts,1 TBS flour, 1 TBS melted butter and 1/8 tsp ground
cinnamon. Sprinkle over batter and bake on 350° for 1 hour

recipes.title: Mee Maw"s Hushpuppies
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Mee Maw"s Hushpuppies.
instructions: Mix with buttermilk and let it sit to rise it will double in size. Stir
down and fry in hot oil.

recipes.title: Mexican Cornbread
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Mexican Cornbread.
instructions: Mix all ingredients together and pour in a greased 9 x 13 pan.
Cook for 25 minutes at 400°

recipes.title: Quick Mexican Cornbread
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Quick Mexican Cornbread.
instructions: Mix ingredients together and drop into greased mini cupcake pans.
Bake @ 400° for 10 15 minute until golden brown.

recipes.title: Mee Maw"s BBQ Sauce
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Mee Maw"s BBQ Sauce.
ingredients: Enough Ketchup to desired thickness (at least 2 cups)
instructions: Mix all ingredients, whisking to mix everything together. Put in
medium size pot and heat, bringing it to a boil. When boiling, turn
down to simmer, stirring to prevent sticking. When thick, it's done!
Add salt and pepper to taste.
recipes.notes:
Great on chicken and pork. In a hurry? Just mix it
all up, pour into the crockpot over chicken breasts or pork
tenderloin and be ready for a yummy dinner when you get home
from work!!

recipes.title: Thousand Island Dressing
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Thousand Island Dressing.
instructions: Mix all of the above well. Can leave chunky or if preferred can be
blended smooth. Any of the ingred. can be increased or decreased
according to taste.

recipes.title: Brocolli and Cheddar Soup
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Brocolli and Cheddar Soup.
instructions: Cook brocolli in small amount of water and 1 1/2 cups chicken
broth.
When tender, squash brocolli with potato masher. Stir in soup,
dissolve well. Add approx. 1 1/2 cups grated cheddar cheese,
sprinkle well with garlic salt and add salt and pepper to taste. Cook
slowly till thickened. If not thick enough add 1 tbsp. cornstarch
(mixed with water)
If you prefer you can use extra chicken broth instead of soup and
thicken with half and half and cornstarch.

recipes.title: Irish Stew
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Irish Stew.
instructions: Using a large skillet add 1 TBS olive oil. With pan and oil very hot
brown beef.
Take browned meat out and "deglaze" pan with a little bit of water
or red wine. The wine helps to give it more flavor. Add enough
water to this to cover meat. Turn down and simmer for several
hours until meat is very tender.
Cut up potatoes and carrots into pan and add diced tomatoes.
Simmer this until potatoes and carrots are tender. Add salt and
pepper as desired. You can also add some garlic powder for flavor.
recipes.notes:
Serve with corn muffins---just like Mee Maw
always has!! YUMMY !!

recipes.title: Potato Soup
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Potato Soup.
ingredients: 1 - 32 oz box of chicken broth or "homemade"
instructions: Mince leek and cut potatoes into bite size.
Saute leek in butter
When tender add potatoes and broth
cook till tender
Spoon out about 1 cup of broth and whisk with the cream cheese
Add this mixture back to soup
Add enough milk to make soup
Add salt and pepper to taste

recipes.title: Taco Soup
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Taco Soup.
ingredients: 1 15 oz can black beans rinsed and drained
instructions: Brown ground beef,onion and garlic in large dutch oven. Stirring
often until done. Stir in the rest of the ingredients. Add beef broth
or water to desired consistency. Simmer 30 minutes

recipes.title: Vegetable Soup
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Vegetable Soup.
ingredients: tomatoes (fresh is best for all vegetables, but canned or frozencan be used)
instructions: In saucepan add tomatoes (if canned use large)
salt and pepper to taste.
Cook till all vegetables are tender. Any other vegetable can be
added if desired. Stir during cooking to be sure corn does not stick
to bottom of pan.

recipes.title: Beef and Macaroni (Goulash)
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Beef and Macaroni (Goulash).
instructions: Brown 1 to 1/2 lbs ground chuck (drain grease when browned)
Add 1 can tomatoe sauce, 1/2 cup water and 1 cup macaroni, 1
small
chopped onion (optional, but makes much better). Add small
amount of each sauce, probably 2 tsp. each. Season with salt,
pepper and garlic powder. Cover and let cook slowly till macaroni
is tender. If more water is needed, add small amount. Let it cook
out before serving.
recipes.notes:
This can be served as is, or can be put into baking
dish and topped with cheddar cheese. Place in oven till cheese is
melted. Do not overcook

recipes.title: Blackeye Peas
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Blackeye Peas.
ingredients: ham bone or a hunk of ham
instructions: Pour 1 cup of peas( make sure and wash them before you cook
them) in a med sauce pan.
Add enough water to cover them.
Add salt and ham bone or ham
Bring to a boil and turn down to med. and cook for about 45
minutes adding water as needed. As they get tender taste them to
make sure you have enough salt.

recipes.title: Broccoli Salad
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Broccoli Salad.
instructions: Mix sugar , vinegar and mayo together and set aside.
Fry bacon and crumble up
Cut broccoli into bite sizes
Add everything and mix.

recipes.title: Broccoli-Corn Casserole
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Broccoli-Corn Casserole.
ingredients: 1 - 10 oz. pkg frozen, chopped broccoli, thawed
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine corn, thawed broccoli, 1/2 cup crushed
crackers, onion, butter, salt and pepper. Pour into buttered 1 quart
casserole.
TOPPING:
combine remaining 1/2 cup cracker crumbs and 4
Tablespoons butter. Sprinkle over vegetable mixture. Bake
casserole, uncovered, at 350° for 35 40 minutes or until well
heated.
recipes.notes:
Nana (Frances Pittard) used to make this all the
time when we went to their house for dinner. I don't love broccoli
but this is very good!!

recipes.title: Candied Yams
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Candied Yams.
instructions: Peel and cut potatoes into approx 1/4 inch rounds. Place in baking
dish.
Add sugar and water together and pour over potatoes. Cut butter
into squares and place on potatoes. Cover with foil or lid and bake
till potatoes are very tender, probably 1 to 1/2 hours, at 350
degrees. Check for tenderness after 1 hr. When tender mix 1 tbsp.
cornstarch with small amount of water and stir into potatoes.
Recover and cook till liquid thickens. I like to turn broiler on after
thickened and let top brown.

recipes.title: Collard Greens
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Collard Greens.
instructions: Get about 5 6 bunches of collards clean remove rib and slice.
Brown the onions, garlic, and bacon in pot then add greens and
chicken broth. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Bring to a boil,
Simmer on low, covered for about an hour add spices and
seasonings.
Let it cook for another 20 minutes or so

recipes.title: Creamed Corn
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Creamed Corn.
ingredients: olive oil (or your choice of seasoning)
Shuck , silk and wash corn. With a very sharp knife, clip the very
tops of the kernals, when all are cli
Fresh ears of corn (2 ears per persons)
Slice of bacon or vegetable oil
instructions: Using a serrated bread knife, take off just the tops of the kernels.
Once all the
tops are off, scrape the rest of the corn off of the ear. (This will be
very
sloppy, as the cream from the corn splatters! Wear goggles!
HAHA)
Fry a piece of bacon to get some grease in which to fry the corn (if
you don't want to use bacon, use a little vegetable oil or butter).
Remove the bacon and put all the corn into the hot grease. Stir
constantly then turn down the heat. Add salt and pepper to taste
and add some water if it's not real creamy. Stir intermittently while
cooking on low heat. Cook 10 minutes, taste and see if it's done!!
recipes.notes:
Of course, all the Clarks like using white, sweet
corn. YUMM-O!! Be sure
and bake some biscuits and fried okra to serve with the fresh corn!

recipes.title: Deviled Eggs
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Deviled Eggs.
instructions: Boil eggs in heavily salted water.
Turn heat off and keep covered for 20 minutes.
Pour water off and run cold water over them.
Peel eggs.
Cut in half and take yolk out putting yolk in a bowl
Mix yolk with mayonnaise,mustard, salt and pepper. You want it
to be creamy not dry and crumbly.
recipes.notes:
If you want it a spicy- you can add red pepper to
yolk mixture.

recipes.title: Fried Okra
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Fried Okra.
instructions: Wash okra.
Slice okra into small pieces.
Salt really well and let them sit for about 30 minutes.
Pour flour over them to cover all okra and toss.
Sift unused flour out of okra pieces.
Fry in batches and drain on paper towels
recipes.notes:
Make a lot of this when you make it because
everybody loves it!!

recipes.title: Frozen Fruit Salad
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Frozen Fruit Salad.
instructions: Combine all ingredients, mixing thoroughly. Pour mixture into
individual muffin tins or a baking dish and cut into individual
pieces when frozen.
Put in freezer!!
recipes.notes:
I think this was Tricia's original recipe, but I stole
it!! Yummy!

recipes.title: Green Beans
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Green Beans.
instructions: Wash and string green beans and break into pieces.
Put in med pan and pour in enough water to almost cover beans.
Salt really well
Lay 1 piece of bacon on top
or
1 TBS olive oil
The bacon taste a lot better trust me!!
Cook until tender.
recipes.notes:
About 30 minutes before green beans are done I
will add 8-10 little new potatoes or red potatoes â€¦.yummy!!

recipes.title: Layered Salad
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Layered Salad.
ingredients: Head of lettuce (cleaned, dried and cut in bite sized pieces
1 - 1 1/2 Cup Mayonaise (depends on how juicy you want the salad!)
3 4 Tbs Balsamic Vinegar (or any other flavored vineragrette)
Frozen green peas (Optional... can't really tell if they're there or not!)
instructions: Layer a casserole pan with lettuce. Mix the mayo, sugar and
vinegar together. Spread some over the lettuce. Sprinkle with
crispy bacon (can you use bacon bits but freshly cooked bacon is
better!), cut up green onions, cheese and peas. Do it all over again
just like lasagna.
recipes.notes:
Make a couple of hours early, cover and put in
refrigerator so the tastes can meld.

recipes.title: Lyonnaise Potatoes
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Lyonnaise Potatoes.
instructions: Peel and cut 4 medium irish potatoes into approx. 1/4" slices, cut 1
med. onion into strips. Pour small amout of olive oil into pan, heat
and add potatoes and onions. Slowly saute until tender,(stir
occasionally) and let some of the potatoes slightly brown. Sprinkle
with garlic powder, salt and pepper.
recipes.notes:
Great as a side dish with almost anything.
Sides & Vegetables

recipes.title: Macaroni and Cheese
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Macaroni and Cheese.
instructions: Boil noodles till al dente' and set aside.
In a large sauce pan melt butter.
Add flour to this and whisk until it's absorbed in butter.
SLOWLY add the milk and whisk till smooth.
Cook on med heat until as thick as cream.
Add cheese and let it melt.
Put noodles in a 9 X 13 and pour cheese sauce on top.
Top with extra cheese.
Bake at 375 till cheese has melted.

recipes.title: MaryAnn"s Strawberry Congealed Salad
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for MaryAnn"s Strawberry Congealed Salad.
instructions: Mix jellos together and add to water. Stir in pineapple, strawberries
and pecans.
Pour half of this mixture into a mold or an 8 X 8 pan. Let it set up
and spread sour cream on top and add the other half of mixture.
Refridgerate until set.

recipes.title: Onion Rings
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Onion Rings.
instructions: Peel and slice onion into 1/4 to 1/2 inch rings. Separate rings, put
in bowl and pour buttermilk over rings. (about 3/4 cup. buttermilk.
Be sure rings are wet with the milk and coat with flour (Self rising)
Coat well, but knock off access. Deep fry to a golden brown. Serve
warm.

recipes.title: Potato Salad
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Potato Salad.
instructions: Boil potatoes until tender. Boil eggs in a different pan in salted
water.
Peel potatoes and cut into bite size chunks.
Mix 1/2 cup mayo with 1 tsp mustard and 1/4 cup pickle relish,
and 2 TBS pimentos
Cut eggs into chunks.
Combine all this into a large bowl and mix. Add salt and pepper to
taste.
When salad sits it tends to dry out so you might need to add more
mayo and mustard before you serve.

recipes.title: Ramen Noodle Salad
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Ramen Noodle Salad.
instructions: Saute crushed ramen noodles, almonds and sunflower seed in stick
of butter.
Drain on a paper towel.
Tear lettuce depending on what size salad you're making.
Cut up broccoli into bite sizes.
Put everything into large bowl and toss with dressing.

recipes.title: Strawberry Salad
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Strawberry Salad.
instructions: Mix the dressing ingredients and heat set aside.
Mix lettuce together and toss with strawberries, nuts and cheese.
Toss with dressing right before serving or you can serve dressing
on the side.
recipes.notes:
You can make dressing days in advance but it
tends to get sweeter as it sits in refrigerator.

recipes.title: Chicken & Broccoli Casserole
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Chicken & Broccoli Casserole.
ingredients: 3 4 chicken breasts (cooked and cut into bite size pieces)
2, 10 oz packages frozen broccoli (I like fresh too many stalks in frozen)
1/2 tsp curry powder (I do not use)
instructions: Cook Broccoli. Place in a greased casserole dish (9 x 13) Place
chicken over broccoli. Mix soup, mayonnaise, lemon juice & curry
powder. Spread over chicken.
Top with cheese and then cracker crumbs.
Bake @ 350° for 30 35 minutes.

recipes.title: Chili Cheese Egg Casserole
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Chili Cheese Egg Casserole.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°
Mix baking powder, flour and dry mustard.
Beat in eggs.
Blend in remaining ingredients.
Batter will be slightly lumpy.
Grease casserole dish and pour in.
Bake for 25 35 min or until firm in middle.

recipes.title: Corn Pudding
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Corn Pudding.
instructions: Mix all ingredients together and pour into q 9 X 13 casserole dish.
Bake 350° for 1 hour

recipes.title: Garlic Cheese Grits
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Garlic Cheese Grits.
instructions: Cook grits according to package. I use the microwave. Initially,
cook for 3 minutes to get it hot. Take it out and stir every 1 minute
or so until they're done. Cook them pretty done, adding water if
they still taste grainy. Then, add salt to your taste, cheese to your
taste, cream cheese to make them creamy and as many Alouette
Garlic and Herb packages as you like (the more the richer!) Taste
as you go and you'll know!
Bake at 350° until firm and cheese is melted.
recipes.notes:
There's no set amount of anything. Just add, taste
and add more of what you think it's missing. If I make a big pan of
it, I'll add 1/2 package of cream cheese, a couple of Alouette's and
enough cheese to make it cheesy without overpowering it.

recipes.title: Impossibly Easy Ham and Swiss Pie
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Impossibly Easy Ham and Swiss Pie.
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups cut up fully cooked ham
instructions: Heat oven to 400°. Grease pie plate. Sprinkle ham, cheese and
onion in pie plate. Stir remaining ingredients until blended. Pour
into pie plate.
Bake 35-40 minutes or until knife inserted in center comes out
clean. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.
recipes.notes:
Mee Maw says this is GREAT! It makes its' own
crust with the Bisquick!
Impossibly easy!!

recipes.title: Poppyseed Chicken Casserole
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Poppyseed Chicken Casserole.
ingredients: chopped chicken from a whole chicken
instructions: Boil chicken until done, let cool and de bone.
Mix together soup and sour cream set aside
Melt butter in a small bowl add crushed ritz crackers and
poppyseed.
In a 9 X 13 put chicken on bottom. Add soup and sour cream
mixture on top of this. Add cracker mixture on top.
Bake at 375° for 30 minutes.

recipes.title: Squash Casserole
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Squash Casserole.
instructions: Cook squash and onion in water until tender. Drain and smash.
Add butter and 2 cups of cheese. Add eggs, sour cream and
crackers. Mix well. Add salt and pepper to taste. Place in shallow
2 quart greased casserole. Top with more cheese and bake,
uncovered, at 350° for 30 minutes (or until well heated and cheese
is melted.)
recipes.notes:
Get the squash very tender and drain ALL the
water out of it or it will be too smooshy!!

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Casserole
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Sweet Potato Casserole.
instructions: Add all ingredients and beat with mixer just till combined. Pour
into a buttered 9 X 13 pan.
Mix topping ingredientsÍ¾ mixing in the butter with a pastry cutter.
Topping should be crumbly.
Put on top of sweet potatoes.
Bake on 375° for 20 30 minutes.

recipes.title: Talk Talk"s Squash Casserole
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Talk Talk"s Squash Casserole.
ingredients: 1 Small onion, chopped fine (I cook mine with the squash)
1/2 Cup Saltine or Ritz Crackers, crumbled
instructions: Mix first 5 ingredients and season to taste with salt and pepper.
Pour in a casserole dish. Mix melted butter and crackers together
and sprinkle on top of squash mixture.
Bake at 350 for approximately 30 minutes.
recipes.notes:
If you don't have cream of mushroom soup, you
can also substitute sour cream and more cheese for a cheesier dish.

recipes.title: Apricot Tenderloin
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Apricot Tenderloin.
instructions: Melt the butter in a frying pan and brown all sides of the pork
tenderloin.
Take pork out and stir in jelly with remaining butter. Put pork back
in pan and pour this mixture over it. Bake at 400° for 45 minutes.
Mix gravy according to package and pour over tenderloin and cook
for another 15 minutes.
recipes.notes:
This is really good with mashed potatoes and fried
okra! Love the combination!

recipes.title: Beef Brisket
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Beef Brisket.
instructions: Sprinkle Lawry's Seasoning Salt very liberally over both sides of
the brisket. Cook at a very high temperature for 1 hour, uncovered.
(If it's a small brisket, bake at 450°. If it's a fatter one, bake at 475°.
Take out of oven and pour 1 can of coke over whole brisket. Cover
tightly with aluminum foil and cook at 275° for 3 hours.
Take out of oven. Remove all the fat. Cut into small bite sized
pieces and enjoy with the au jus. Great with rolls.
recipes.notes:
The first time I tried this, I accidentally bought a
corn-beef brisket and it was the wrong thing!! Wasn't too good!!
Get just a plain beef brisket!

recipes.title: Beef Stroganoff
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Beef Stroganoff.
instructions: Brown onions in butter then brown ground beef. Add flour and stir.
Add soup, garlic, salt and pepper. Cook on low heat for 20
minutes. Fold in sour cream.
Serve over buttered noodles.
recipes.notes:
The onions get really soft, so all you picky people
(Dannah) won't even know they're in there!!

recipes.title: Better than Take-out Fried Rice
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Better than Take-out Fried Rice.
instructions: Prepare rice.
Heat sesame oil in a large skillet on medium heat.
Add onion, garlic, peas and carrots.
Stir fry until tender.
Crack eggs into pan and scramble, mixing throughout vegetables.
Add rice and soy sauce.
Add more soy sauce if it seems dry.
You can add rotisserie chicken to this or serve with Honey
Teriyaki Chicken.
recipes.notes:
Make sure eggs are completely cooked with
vegetables. They will look like scrambled eggs when done.

recipes.title: Cajun Turkey Breast
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Cajun Turkey Breast.
instructions: Brush turkey with butter. Place turkey in a browning bag. Mix
remaining ingredients together and pour over turkey in the bag.
Bake at 300° for 4 hours.
recipes.notes:
Don't open the bag the whole cooking time!! It
will stay tender that way!
This is so good with rolls or as a meat entree. This originated from
Lynn DeLoach.

recipes.title: Chicken & Dumplings
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Chicken & Dumplings.
ingredients: 2 3 Chicken breasts (If you use bone in chicken, you get a better tasting broth)
instructions: Boil chicken pieces until falling apart.
Remove chicken and continue to boil broth. Add 1/4 stick butter,
salt & pepper.

recipes.title: Chicken and Rice
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Chicken and Rice.
ingredients: 1 envelope of Lipton onion soup mix
instructions: Mix soup, onion soup mix, rice and 2 cans of water add slowlytogether.
Pour into 9 X 13 pan and then place chicken pieces on
top of that. Cover and bake in a 375 oven for about 1 hour. If using
bone in chicken pieces it might take longer to cook.

recipes.title: Chicken Pot Pie
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Chicken Pot Pie.
ingredients: fresh corn if available cut off cobb
instructions: Boil chicken until done and let it cool and then shred.
Boil potatoes and carrots until almost tender and then add peas and
corn for one minute . Drain and set aside.
In a large plastic bowl add 2 cups sr flour and 1 cup cheddar
cheese. Mix until all incorporated. Add a little bit of water if it's
dry won't come together. Form into a ball and it all holds together.
On a floured surface roll out the size of your pan.
In a 9 X 13 pan put chicken on bottom and vegetables on top of
that.
In a medium skillet add 4 TBS butter and let it melt. Add 4 TBS of
sr flour and whisk it in with the butter. Slowly add some chicken
broth to this to make a "rue".
Add some milk to give it some color and make it a little richer.
Most of the liquid should be broth. Pour over the top of chicken
and vegetables. Then add the crust on top of that.
Bake on 400 for 30 minutes or until it's golden brown on top.

recipes.title: Chicken Taco Salad
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Chicken Taco Salad.
instructions: Season roast as desired, place in baking dish. Quarter onion and
place around roast, pour 3 to 4 tbsp. worcestershire over roast.
Cover and bake at 350 degrees 31/2 to 4 hours. Remove meat from
broth, heat to boiling on stove and add tomato sauce. Heat enough
to mix well.
recipes.notes:
Roast is to be pulled or served as chunks. Will not
slice. Place meat on platter and pour gravy over.

recipes.title: Debbie Turner Chicken
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Debbie Turner Chicken.
instructions: Mix all together and dredge chicken in it.
Make sure the chicken is covered well.
Bake on 375° for 30 minutes.
recipes.notes: The White boys LOVE this chicken

recipes.title: Fried Chicken
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Fried Chicken.
ingredients: whole chicken, cut up OR chicken strips or breasts
instructions: Put chicken pieces in a bowl and cover with buttermilk.
In another bowl add 2 cups self rising flour and salt and pepper to
taste.
Put chicken pieces in flour one at a time and cover well.
Heat oil in a frying pan make sure it's very hot!!
Fry until good and brown on one

recipes.title: Funeral Chicken
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Funeral Chicken.
instructions: Pour small amount of sauce into baking dish. Place chicken in
dish, top with ranch dressing. Bake at 325 degrees for 20 to 25
minutes (depending on size of chicken). Top with grated cheddar
cheese and cook 5 to 10 minutes longer till cheese melts.
recipes.notes:
If chicken is large pieces, I cut them in half
(lengthwise). You can use chicken tenders but do not overcook.
We gave it this name because it was served for a dinner after a
funeral and we all liked it, but had no other name for it.

recipes.title: Grilled Honey-Teriyaki Chicken
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Grilled Honey-Teriyaki Chicken.
ingredients: glaze: 1 large (1 inch) piece fresh ginger root
glaze: 1 head garlic, cut in half
instructions: Make the brine by putting everything in a plastic bag.
Add chicken and let it brine for 1 2 hours in refrigerator.
Preheat grill to medium heat or you can do it in a grill pan.
Add the chicken to a large mixing bowl and drizzle with olive oil
and pepper.
Grill until done.
Baste with teriyaki glaze for the last 5 minutes.
Serve with Stir Fried Rice
GLAZE:
In a sm saucepan combine teriyaki sauce,
honey,ginger, garlic. Simmer until rich and slightly reduced.

recipes.title: Leftover Beef Hash
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Leftover Beef Hash.
instructions: When you have leftover roast beef, pull or cut into small pieces,
put in frying pan with small amount of water. Peel and cube
potatoes for the amount of beef that you have. Don't add too many.
Add the chopped onion. If you have leftover gravy, add that in too
for flavor. Cook slowly till potatoes are well done and begin to
come apart.

recipes.title: Lime and Cilantro Chicken Salad
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Lime and Cilantro Chicken Salad.
ingredients: 4 5 boneless skinless chicken breasts, seasoned with salt and pepper, grilled
and cut into bite size pieces
dressing: 1/3 cup seasoned rice wine vinegar
dressing: 1 tsp pureed chipotle chiles in adobe sauce
dressing: 1 cup chopped fresh cilantro stems and leaves
instructions: Toss other salad ingredients in a chilled bowl.
DRESSING:
blend all ingredients in blender, but add the
canola oil last in a slow steady stream.
recipes.notes:
This salad is unbelievable in the summer, with all
the fresh vegetable ingredients. You could also substitute grilled
shrimp for the chicken. I first had this salad at Nordstrom Cafe. It's
VERY good! People will be impressed!

recipes.title: Meatloaf
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Meatloaf.
instructions: Mix ground beef, about 1/2 pkg. onion soup mix, 2 tbsp. each of
the sauces, 1 egg, oatmeal and garlic powder (just sprinkle over
top). Mix thoroughly (I use my hand, AFTER WASHING
THOROUGHLY) Make into loaf shape, place in pan and bake 45
min. to 1 hr. at 350 degrees.
When done top with catsup (or mixture of catsup and mustard),
return to over for about 5 minutes.
recipes.notes: Chopped green pepper can be added if you like the taste.

recipes.title: Oven-Fried Chicken
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Oven-Fried Chicken.
instructions: Stir together first 6 ingredients in a mixing bowl. Combine cracker
crumbs with Parm cheese in a shallow dish. Brush chicken with
mayonnaise mixture, dredge in crumb mixture. Place on a baking
sheet.
Bake at 400° for 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Pork Loin with Red Plum Sauce
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Pork Loin with Red Plum Sauce.
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°. Sprinkle pork with garlic and onion saltsÍ¾
place fat side up in roasting pan. Cook for 25 minutes per pound.
Melt butter, add onion, and cook until tender. Add remaining
ingredientsÍ¾ simmer for 15 minutes.
Pour 1/2 the sauce over pork meat. Cook an additional 20 30
minutes. Serve extra sauce on the side.

recipes.title: Roast Beef
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Roast Beef.
ingredients: 3/4 lb. beef roast (I prefer rump, bottom round, sirloin tip or eye of round)
salt, pepper, garlic powder and cornstarch
instructions: Season to taste with salt, pepper and garlic powder. Place roast in
dutch over or large pan, add 1/2 cup water and cover. Cook for
approx. 3 and 1/2 hrs. at 350 degrees. Remove roast from pan, heat
broth to boiling, add approx. 1/2 of dressing mix and thicken to
desired consistency with cornstarch.
recipes.notes: If broth is too strong for gravy, water can be added to taste.

recipes.title: Salmon Patties
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Salmon Patties.
instructions: Empty salmon into bowl. Remove skin and as many bones as you
can. Squish up the tiny ones and you'll never know they're there.
(Great source of calcium!) Mix the salmon with 1 egg and flour.
Make into pat tie and fry in a small amount of oil.
recipes.notes:
These are so quick and easy! And good for you!
Mee Maw always served them with "ho cakes." Just put cornmeal
in a bowl, add some salt and water, making a runny paste
consistency. Pour onto hot, greased frying pan and fry up little
patties of cornbread. Yum Yum!

recipes.title: Spaghetti and Meatballs
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Spaghetti and Meatballs.
instructions: Heat large skillet.
In a medium bowl add ground round, 3 TBS of dry sauce mix,
garlic powder, basil, parsley,steak sauces and mix well.
Form meat into meatballs and brown in skillet. Drain on paper
towels and pour out drippings and add a little water to deglaze pan
and add to sauce pan.
In a different medium sauce pan add tomato sauce,paste and
remaining dry sauce mix. Add garlic, basil,
parsley,worchestershire, A1 and 1 tsp sugar and salt and pepper to
taste. Simmer until noodles are done and serve over noodles.

recipes.title: Stuffed Peppers
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Stuffed Peppers.
ingredients: oatmeal (I like to use quick cooking)
instructions: Cut peppers in half and take out seed and pulp. Mix chuck (I pinch
off enough meat that I think will fill each pepper)., 1 egg yolk,
sauces (small amt. of each), 2 tbsp. oatmeal, season with garlic
powder, salt and pepper to taste. Press mixture into pepper halves
and bake uncovered in 350 degree oven for approx. 30/45 minutes
(depending on oven). You can check of doneness by inserting
knife. Top the meat with catsup, return to oven and let heat about 5
minutes. Serve warm.
recipes.notes:
If you prefer, cooked rice can be used instead of
oatmeal, but you would want to use probably about 1 cup.

recipes.title: Turkey and Dressing
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Turkey and Dressing.
ingredients: 1 giant loaf white bread (can be store brand)
instructions: Remove packaged parts in neck and/or rear (I wash my turkey)
Dry turkey on outside and season with salt, pepper and garlic
powder (as desired). Rub turkey with butter (at room temp.) I bake
mine in a roaster pan with cover, but any large pan can be used and
tent made from foil for cover. Add 1 cup water to pan. Bake at 350
degrees or according to instructions on wrapper. Will take approx.
3 to 3 1/2 hrs. Don't overcook.
After baking about 2 hrs. drain broth from pan and save for
dressing.
Broth from turkey makes best dressing. If more meat is needed you
can also bake a turkey breast.
DRESSING:
Mix 3 cups self rising cornmeal mix, 1 med. chopped onion and 6
eggs with enough buttermilk to make it consistancy of cornbread.
Bake at 350 degrees till brown.
Crumble loaf bread and cornbread in large pan, add broth and mix
well.(I
usually boil chicken parts for extra broth (backs make good broth).
Mix enough broth till dressing is very moist. Bake 350 degrees till
brown.
(Save approx. 1 cup of dressing for gravy)
GRAVY:
Use remaining broth for gravy. Add dressing mixture and 3 boiled
eggs
(chopped). Boil gravy mixture enough to get dressing mixed in and
comes to a boil. Add enough cornstarch to thicken as desired.
Of course, you want to serve with cranberry sauce.

recipes.title: Almond Cake
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Almond Cake.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350.
combine all ingredients together and mix with fork.
Pour into 8 in square pan and cover with slivered almonds.
Bake for 25 30 minutes

recipes.title: Apple Crisp
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Apple Crisp.
ingredients: topping: 3/4 cup light brown sugar, packed
topping: 1/2 pound cold unsalted butter, diced
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Butter a 9 by 14 by 2 inch oval
baking dish.
Peel, core, and cut the apples into large wedges. Combine the
apples with the juices, sugar. Pour into the dish.
Place the crisp on a sheet pan and bake for 1 hour until the top is
brown and the apples are bubbly. Serve warm.
TOPPING:
combine the flour, sugars, salt, oatmeal, and
cold butter in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle
attachment. Mix on low speed until the mixture is crumbly and the
butter is the size of peas. Scatter evenly over the apples. (Or you
can use your hands...mess!)
recipes.notes: Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

recipes.title: Aunt Betty"s Chess Cake
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Aunt Betty"s Chess Cake.
instructions: Mix first 3 ingredients together and press into a 9 X 13 pan.
Mix next 3 ingredients and pour on top of the other and bake at
350° for 30 40 minutes.

recipes.title: Aunt Lucille"s Brownies
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Aunt Lucille"s Brownies.
instructions: Melt butter and dissolve cocoa, let cooland add other ingredients,
adding pecan last. Bake in smaller baking dish (greased) at 350
degrees for 30 to 35 minutes. Can be iced if desired, but delicious
without.

recipes.title: Baked Apples
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Baked Apples.
instructions: Peel and core apples and place in a shallow pan.
Put 1/2 tsp butter into each apple and sprinkle with sugar.
Bake 350° for about 30 minutes.
recipes.notes: You can add any spice to these that you likecinnamon, nutmeg, all spice.

recipes.title: Banana Cake
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Banana Cake.
instructions: Mix together the first 3 ingredients and bring to a boil.
While it's getting hot, smash 3 bananas and add to boiling mixture.
Bring back to a boil.
Bake either the Yellow Cake mix or a bought yellow cake mix.
Poke holes in each layer (or sheet cake) and pour the sugary
mixture all over the cake.
recipes.notes:
The bananas will turn black and look yucky. To
deter that from happening, eat it all the first night you make it! :)
This is a recipe and half. This is good if using 3 layers of cake, but
for a sheet cake only a single recipe is necessary.

recipes.title: Boston Creme Pie/Cake
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Boston Creme Pie/Cake.
ingredients: Devils Food Cake mix mixed per instructions on box
Fudge Sauce ( see Lisa's in cookbook)
instructions: Bake cake mix in two cake pans and cool.
Make fudge sauce and set aside
Assemble cake by putting one layer on bottom of cake plate.
Pour pudding on top of that.
Add the second layer on top.
Serve with fudge sauce on top and a dollop of whip cream on top
of that!
FILLING:
Mix sugar, flour and eggs and a little milk until smooth.
Add remaining milk slowly until all incorporated.
Cook on medium heatÍ¾ stirring constantly until thick , like pudding.
Take off heat and add vanilla and butter. Whisk until butter is melted.

recipes.title: Caramel Cake
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Caramel Cake.
ingredients: Boxed Cake Mix Yellow or French Vanilla
frosting: 3 Cups sugar take 3 Tbsp from this and place in a small skillet
instructions: Bake cake according to instructions on box using 3 cake pans. DO
NOT over bake cake will be dry!
If instructions say bake for 20 minutes, check at 15 minutes just to
be safe. Cool before icing.
FROSTING:
Combine all ingredients except vanilla and 3 Tbsp sugar. Stir over
medium heat until sugar dissolves and butter melts.
When butter is almost melted, begin "burning" the 3 Tbsp of sugar
in the small skillet over med high heat. The sugar will begin to
melt around the edges and as you stir with a flat spatula, it may
form hard balls of sugar. Continue to stir it until it melts
completely and begins to turn brown. When it becomes a dark
amber color AND the other pan is boiling rapidly, add the caramel
to the boiling mixture, stirring constantly. When it has mixed
completely, stop stirring and continue to boil for 1 minute.
Remove from heat and add vanilla. Pour into a bowl and beat by
hand or on lowest speed with mixer. It will have a silky shine to it
when you start. As it cools, it begins to thicken and will loose that
shine. May take up to 30 minutes by hand and 15 -20 minutes with
mixer for it to be ready. That is when you should start icing the
cake layers. Makes a 3 layer stacked cake or you can make a sheet
cake and pour icing on top.
recipes.notes:
Practice makes perfect on this icing. But don't
worry, the Clark family will be glad to test every cake you make!
Desserts

recipes.title: Carrot Cake
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Carrot Cake.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Cream together sugar, eggs, cinnamon, soda. Add the rest of the
ingredients and mix until creamy.
Spray 3 round baking pans with Pam and pour ingredients equally
into all 3. bake for 30 minutes.
Frost with a cream cheese icing with pecans. (See Cream Cheese
Frosting)
recipes.notes:
Cake is done when you press the top of it and it
springs back up. Or, you can stick a toothpick or knife in it and if it
comes out clean, it's done!!

recipes.title: Chess Cake
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Chess Cake.
instructions: Mix cake mix, 1 egg and butter. Press mixture into 13 X 9 baking
dish
Mix cream cheese (at room temp.), conf. sugar and 2 eggs and
pour on top of cake mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 to 45
minutes. When cool, cut into squares and serve.

recipes.title: Chocolate Cake
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Chocolate Cake.
ingredients: Cake mix Yellow or French Vanilla
instructions: Bake cake according to instructions on box using 3 cake pans. DO
NOT over bake cake will be dry!
If instructions say bake for 20 minutes, check at 15 minutes just to
be safe. Cool before icing.
Combine all ingredients except vanilla. Stir over medium heat until
sugar dissolves and butter melts. Bring to a rapid boil and continue
to boil for 1 1/2 minutes. Remove from heat and add vanilla. Pour
into a bowl and beat by hand or on lowest speed with mixer. It will
have a silky shine to it when you start. As it cools, it begins to
thicken and will loose that shine. That is when you should start
icing the cake layers. Makes a 3 layer stacked cake or you can
make a sheet cake and pour icing on top.

recipes.title: Chocolate Delight
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Chocolate Delight.
instructions: Mix together the flour, butter and pecans. The mixture will be used
to press into the bottom of a rectangular glass baking dish, to form
a crust. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes. Let cool.
Mix sugar, cream cheese and 1/2 container of Cool whip together
and spread on top of cooled crust.
Mix pudding and milk together, allowing it to thicken. Pour on top
of sugar mixture.
Top with Cool Whip.
recipes.notes:
This is a great dessert when you need to serve a lot
of people. Very little cooking involved... just takes time to do the
different layers.

recipes.title: Chocolate Sheet Cake
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Chocolate Sheet Cake.
ingredients: 2 cups sugar 1/2 cup butter 1 box conf sugar
2 sticke of butter 2 TBS cocoa 1 tsp vanilla
1 cup water Melt butter and cocoa then add milk,
frosting: 1/2 stick butter (can be cut to 1/4 stick butter)
instructions: Add chocolate chips.
Bake for 30 minutes
FROSTING:
Put cream cheese & butter in bowl and mix until smoothÍ¾ add
vanilla. Mix in sugar in small amounts until creamy. Can add milk,
1 tsp at a time, until creamy.

recipes.title: Cream Cheese Pound Cake
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Cream Cheese Pound Cake.
instructions: Cream together 1 8oz. cream cheese (room temp.), 3 sticks butter
(room temp) and 3 cups sugar till very creamy. Add dash of salt
(very little) and 1 1/2 tsp. vanilla, mix, then add 6 eggs alternately
with 3 cups sifted cake flour. Pour into tube pan.
Bake at 325 degrees for 1hr and 20 minutes.
recipes.notes:
Your oven might cook cake quicker. If you check
it for doneness, do so very carefully so it will not fall.

recipes.title: Divinity Fudge
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Divinity Fudge.
instructions: Boil sugar, corn syrup and water together until it reach hard ball
stage (250°)
Beat egg whites and salt at high speed for 3 minutes. Pour syrup
mixture slowly into the beaten whites while still beating at high
speed. Continue beating until mixture forms a peak when beater is
raised. (Sometimes this is 10 minutes or longer. Test a spoonful on
waxed paper and see if it holds a form, no longer runny. Keep
beating if still runny.) Add nuts and vanilla and drop on waxed
paper.
recipes.notes:
We used to LOVE to have Nonie come and visit
us. She was a very industrious woman... could do anything (like
Lisa)! We always made Divinity Fudge with her... if it wasn't
raining! She said you can't make fudge when it's raining because it
won't get thick with all the humidity in the air.

recipes.title: Double Chocolate Coca Cola Cake
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Double Chocolate Coca Cola Cake.
ingredients: 1 cup Coca Cola (real thing, not diet)
frosting: 6 Tablesppon of cream or milk
instructions: In a saucepan, mix Coca Cola, oil, butter and cocoa and bring to a
boil. In another bowl, combine the sugar, flour and salt. Pour the
boiling Cola mixture over the flour mixture and beat well. Add the
eggs, buttermilk, soda and vanilla and beat well. Pour mixture into
a greased and floured 13 x 9 inch baking pan and bake at 350
degrees or 20 to 25 minutes. Remove pan. Cool for about 10
minutes before frosting.
FROSTING:
In a saucepan, combine the butter, cocoa, and milk. Heat
until the butter melts. Beat in the remaining ingredients and spread
on the cake while it's still warm. Enjoy!
recipes.notes: Very moist, rich and yummy!

recipes.title: Duke"s Mayonnaise Chocolate Chocolate Cake
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Duke"s Mayonnaise Chocolate Chocolate Cake.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°, grease and flour (or spray Pam) 3 cake pans.
Sift cocoa, flour, baking soda, salt and sugar into a medium bowl,
mix well. Combine mayo, vanilla and water in an electric mixer at
low speed. Once smooth, slowly add in dry mixture until just
incorporated (DO NOT OVERMIX!). Pour batter into cake pans
and bake for 30 minutes or until done. Cool on wire racks and
frost.
ICING:
In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat butter and cocoa with whisk
attachment until smooth. Add vanilla. Add powdered sugar
alternately with milk until icing reaches a spreadable consistency.
(You may not need all 6 cups of usgar or 6 cups of milk)
recipes.notes:
This make a VERY rich chocolate/chocolate cake.
What could be better than that?!?

recipes.title: Easy Cobbler
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Easy Cobbler.
ingredients: any kind of fruit strawberry, peach, blackberry, etc
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Melt stick of butter in a glass rectangular baking dish. Take out of
oven (wear oven mits... yes, I've forgotten before!).
Mix first three ingredients and pour over melted butter. Sprinkle
the fruit over all the ingredients. Pour 1 cup of water over
everything. If you like it really sweet, you could sprinkle more
sugar on top.
Cook for 45 minutes and if it needs more browning, turn the heat
up to 400 and watch it until it's brown.
recipes.notes:
This is so easy and so yummy. Nana makes it with
strawberries, but I like it with peaches and ICE CREAM!!!

recipes.title: French Silk Chocolate Pie
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for French Silk Chocolate Pie.
ingredients: 2 (1 oz) squares unsweetened baking chocolate, melted and cooled
1 prepared 8 inch pastry shell, baked and cooled
instructions: Cream butter in a mixing bowl.
Gradually beat in the sugar with an electric mixer until light
colored and well blended.
Stir in the thoroughly cooled chocolate and vanilla extract.
Add the eggs, one at a time, beating 5 minutes on medium speed
after each addition.
Spoon the chocolate filling into a cooled, baked pie shell.
Refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving.

recipes.title: German Chocolate Brownies
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for German Chocolate Brownies.
ingredients: 2/3 cup evaporated milk divide into 1/3 cups
instructions: Combine caramels and 1/3 cup eval milk and melt in microwave.
Combine cake mix, milk and butter.
Beat until it holds together.
Mix in nuts.
Press into a greased 9 X 13 pan. Bake at 350° for 6 minutes.
Sprinkle chocolate chips on top and then cover with caramel
mixture.
Bake 350° for 17 20 minutes.
Let them cool before you try to cut.

recipes.title: German Chocolate Cake
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for German Chocolate Cake.
instructions: Heat oven to 350° Grease and flour thee 9 in round cake pans
Microwave chocolate and water in large bowl on high until meltedstir
until melted
Mix flour,baking soda,and salt set aside.
Beat butter and sugar in large bowl with mixer until light and
fluffy. Add egg yolks, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition.
Stir in chocolate mixture and vanilla. Add flour mixture alternately
with buttermilk, beating after each addition.
Beat egg whites in another bowl until stiff peaks form. Gently fold
into batter.
Pour into pans.
Bake 30 minutes or until done. Cool for 15 minutes before
removing from pan.
ICING:
Stir milk, sugar, butter, egg yolks and vanilla in large saucepan.
Stirring constantly, cook on med heat 12 minutes or until thickened
and golden brown. Remove from heat.
Add coconut and pecans. Cool and then spread on cake.
recipes.notes: The cake is better if you make 1 1/2 recipes of the icing.

recipes.title: Haystacks
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Haystacks.
instructions: Melt butterscotch and peanut butter in microwave. Fold in chow
mein noodles. Spoon out onto waxed paper.
recipes.notes: These are so easy and people think you spent a lot of time making them!

recipes.title: Hot Fudge Sauce
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Hot Fudge Sauce.
instructions: In a heavy saucepan, combine the condensed milk, chocolate, and
butter.
Cook and stir over medium low heat until chocolate is melted.
Remove from heat, stir in vanilla.

recipes.title: Ice Cream
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Ice Cream.
instructions: In blender or food processor, add condensed milk, vanilla and half
and half and mix well. Pour into Ice Cream canister and fill to line
with milk. Put canister in the churn and add layers of ice and ice
cream salt.
optional:
Add chocolate syrup to taste after adding milk.
Melt Milky Way bars in microwave and add to canister before
adding the milk. Stir well to mix in mixture.
Add Oreo cookies crumbled before adding milk. Mix well before
churning.
Add peaches, strawberries or other fruits before adding milk.
Chop/smash fruit and add sugar to taste before adding to mixture.
recipes.notes:
There's nothing better than a cup of homemade ice
cream on a hot Sunday afternoon!!!

recipes.title: Italian Cream Cake
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Italian Cream Cake.
ingredients: 1 small can angel flake coconut (I like frozen coconut better)
instructions: Cream butter & shorteningÍ¾ add sugar & beat until mixture is
creamy. Add egg yolks & beat well. Combine flour, salt, soda &
add to creamed mixture alternately with buttermilk. Stir in vanilla.
Add coconut (chopped fine in food processor) & chopped pecans.
Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites. Pour into 3 greased & floured
cake pans.
Bake @ 350° for 20 25 minutes *important not to overcook
layers. Check by sticking knife/toothpick in middle of cake after
20 minutes. If it comes out clean, cake is done. If not check often.
Cool & frost with Cream Cheese Frosting.
recipes.notes:
Aunt Madonna makes this cake using a white cake
mix (gasp!) and adds the coconut and pecans. Much easier and
pretty close to the REAL thing!

recipes.title: Lemon Yogurt Cake
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Lemon Yogurt Cake.
ingredients: glaze: 2 TBS freshly squeezed lemon juice
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°
Grease and flour a loaf pan.
Sift together the flour, baking powder, and salt into a bowl.
In another bowl, whisk together the yogurt, 1 cup sugar, the eggs,
zest and vanilla.
Slowly whisk the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients.
Fold the vegetable oil into the batter, making sure it's all
incorporated.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for about 50
minutes or until done.
Meanwhile, cook the 1/3 cup lemon juice and 1/3 cup sugar until
sugar dissolves.
While the cake is still warm, pour the mixture over it and let it
soak in.

recipes.title: Lisa"s Hot Fudge Sauce
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Lisa"s Hot Fudge Sauce.
instructions: Mix sugar, cocoa & milk in panÍ¾ add butter. Stir over low med
heat, allowing sugar mixture to melt. Bring to a boil and boil
without stirring for 1 1/2 minutes. Remove from heat and add
vanilla.
Can be stored in air tight container in refrigerator for 3 5 days.

recipes.title: Mama Clark"s Pecan Pie
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Mama Clark"s Pecan Pie.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°. Cream sugar, flour and eggs. Add other
ingredients. Bake in deep dish pie shell for approximately 45
minutes. It is done when it jiggles just a little bit in the middle
when shaken!! Remember, it will still appear not done, but will set
up when cool.

recipes.title: Mee Maws Banana Pudding
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Mee Maws Banana Pudding.
instructions: Mix together the sugar and flour.
Add eggs.
Slowly add milk.
Cook over medium heat stirring constantly.
When thick add butter and whisk till melted.
Pour over vanilla wafers and bananas.

recipes.title: Mee Maws Prune Cake
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Mee Maws Prune Cake.
ingredients: 1 TBS each cinnamon, nutmeg and allspice
instructions: Mix dry ingredients. Cook dried prunes with just a little water to
re hydrate. They will become very tender and fall apart. Add to
mixture. Beat only to mix.
Pour into large shallow greased and floured pan.
Bake at 350° for 30 minutes
ICING:
mix ingredients and cook. Bring to a boil. Remove and add 1/2 tsp
baking soda. Punch holes in cake and pour this hot mixture over.
Serve cake warm.

recipes.title: Mee Maws Russian Tea Cakes
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Mee Maws Russian Tea Cakes.
instructions: Mix first three ingredients.
Add the next three.
Form dough into small balls and bake 400°
Roll in confectioners sugar right out of oven.

recipes.title: Micah"s Second Grade "No Bake" Cookies
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Micah"s Second Grade "No Bake" Cookies.
instructions: Mix the peanut butter, honey and dry milk together. Crush some of
the cornflakes in a plastic bag, then roll the peanut butter mixture
into balls and roll in the cornflakes. Even a second grader can do
this!
recipes.notes: I found this recipe tucked inside my cookbook! Sweet memories!

recipes.title: Mississippi Mud
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Mississippi Mud.
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups self rising flour 1 stick butter, softened
instructions: Cream sugar, cocoa and butter. Add eggs and vanilla. Mix. Add
flour and nuts. Beat 2 minutes. Greased pan rectangular. Bake
350° for 35 40 minutes. While hot, spread marshmallow over the
top. Cool and ice.
Icing Mix together powdered sugar, milk, butter and cocoa until
creamy.
recipes.notes: Can you say DELICIOUS?!?! So great with a big tall glass of milk!!

recipes.title: No Bake Cookies
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for No Bake Cookies.
instructions: Mix together sugar, cocoa, butter & milk and bring to a boil for
one minute. Remove from heat, add peanut butter and vanilla. Add
oatmeal and stir. Drop by teaspoon on wax paper. Let cool.

recipes.title: Orange Blossoms
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Orange Blossoms.
ingredients: 1 Box Duncan Hines Deluxe Orange Cake Mix (Or any orange cake mix!)
6 Small Muffin Tins (Or you could do this like a Bundt Cake)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Prepare cake mix according to instructions on box. Pour into tiny
muffin tins or pour it all in a Bundt Cake pan. Bake until very light
brown. Don't overcook!
GLAZE:
Mix the orange and lemon juice with sugar. It will mix
better in the blender if you have one. In not, use a whisk. Put the
small cupcakes on a rack with a pan under them. Pour over small
muffins and saturate the cakes with the glaze.
recipes.notes:
Mee Maw started making these little cupcakes for
Christmas and EVERYBODY loves them! But, the only time
anybody ever makes them is for Christmas, but you can make them
ALL YEAR LONG!

recipes.title: Oreo Balls
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Oreo Balls.
instructions: Finely chop Oreos in food processor. Add cream cheese and mix
well.
Roll mixture into 1 inch balls.
Melt white chocolate. Can be done in double boiler (bottom pan
has water boiling and put pan on top of that to heat and melt
chocolate morsels OR melt small amounts at a time in microwave.)
Dip balls into melted white chocolate and place on wax paper to
dry.
Melt semi sweet chocolate in small amounts in a zip lock bag in
microwave. Cut a tiny corner off the bag and drizzle chocolate
over the balls.

recipes.title: Perfect Pumpkin Pie
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Perfect Pumpkin Pie.
ingredients: 1 (14 oz) can EAGLE BRAND sweetened condensed milk
instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees
Whisk pumpkin, sweetened condensed milk, eggs, spices, and salt
in medium bowl until smooth.
Pour into crust
Bake 15 minutes
Reduce over temperature to 350 degrees and continue baking
35 40 minutes or until knife inserted 1 inch from the crust comes
out clean.
Cool.
Garnish as desired.
recipes.notes: Serve with homemade whipped cream!

recipes.title: Pineapple Upsidedown cake
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Pineapple Upsidedown cake.
ingredients: 1 box cake mix prepared per instructions on box
instructions: melt butter in the bottom of a 9 X 13 pan.
Add enough brown sugar to soak up butter and stir until dissolved.
Pour can of pineapple on top of this.
Add prepared cake mix on top of this and bake at 350° until golden
brown or until done in the middle.

recipes.title: Strawberry Cake
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Strawberry Cake.
instructions: Mix cake mix according to package. Instead of all the water,
squish some of the fresh strawberries up into the measuring cup to
equal the required amount. (The berries will displace the water.)
Grease or Pam 3 cake pans and pour batter evenly. Bake as
instructed. They will cook faster than instructions since you're
baking 3. DO NOT OVERBAKE!
Look up Cream Cheese Frosting and instead of adding milk to
obtain the right consistency, add strawberry juice along with some
finely chopped up strawberries. The icing should turn a nice
strawberry pink!
recipes.notes: This cake is a favorite in the summertime when you can use fresh strawberries.

recipes.title: Sugared Pecans or Peanuts
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Sugared Pecans or Peanuts.
instructions: Dissolve sugar in water, add nuts and continue to cook and stir
until nuts are completely covered. (No syrup left... 12 15 minutes)
Pour on cookie sheet lined with foil. Separate pieces. Bake 30
minutes at 300°. Stir every 5 minutes.
recipes.notes: These are great to eat as a snack or on salads.

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Pie
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Sweet Potato Pie.
ingredients: 1/2 to 1 cup sugar (depending on how sweet you want your pie)
instructions: Follow instructions for the pie crust.
Bake or boil the sweet potatoes until soft. Take the skins off and
put the potatoes in a bowl. Add the butter, sugar and vanilla
flavoring. If it isn't real creamy, add a few teaspoons of milk and
milk until creamy.
Put sweet potatoes in crust and bake according to instructions.
Top with whipped cream or eat plain.

recipes.title: Talk Talk"s Blueberry Pie
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Talk Talk"s Blueberry Pie.
ingredients: 1 can blueberry pie filling (could be strawberry or cherry, as well)
instructions: Prepare crust according to package and allow to cool.
Cream together cream cheese and sugar.
Add half of Cool Whip to mixture.
Mix well.
Add layer of this on bottom of crust then layer the fruit mixture.
Top with other half of Cool Whip.
recipes.notes:
I remember having this at Talk Talk's house. I
don't love blueberries, but I loved it at her house! I recently found
her recipe, handwritten by her!! I miss that girl!!

recipes.title: Tricia"s Chocolate Pie
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Tricia"s Chocolate Pie.
instructions: Combine egg yolks, sugar ,salt, flour and cocoa. Mix very well.
Add milk slowly to get it all incorporated.
Cook on medium heat stirring constantly!
When thickened add vanilla and butter and whisk until butter has
melted.
Pour into a pre cooked 9 in. pie crust
recipes.notes: I add the whole egg but if you want a meringue on top of pie separate egg.

recipes.title: Willa Deane"s Pecan Pie
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Willa Deane"s Pecan Pie.
instructions: Mix ingredients except pecansÍ¾beating well.
then add pecans .
Pour into pie shell.
Bake at 425° for 10 minutes then turn down to 300° for about an
hour.

recipes.title: Yellow Cake Mix
recipes.description: Clark family recipe for Yellow Cake Mix.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°. Cream butter and sugar. Add eggs, milk then
flour , beating after adding each ingredient until creamy.
Spray 3 round cake pans with Pam, pour equally and bake until
golden brown.
recipes.notes: Any frosting would be good on this cake. Chocolate, of course, is the best! :)
